caption: Very friendly and the food is "life changing"

推薦++ Excellent Service. Excellent Bubble Tea. Decent tea. Consistent quality. Most importantly, Bubbles are cooked perfectly and given at a perfect portion to be drink with the tea. (Perfect = If you sip on the tea and bubbles together, you will finish both at the same time) Many bubble tea stores in Chicago dont even give you enough bubbles to go along with the first few sips. You can see the heart they put into making a cup of drink. I'm from Taiwan, and I approved this store. :-)

I've been here few times and very happy about their beverages. I really like the tea latte because they make the ratio between milk and tea just right. The pure tea won't let you down since you can certainly taste the freshness of the tea and other ingredients. Additionally, their staff is super friendly and being patient as I always have the difficulty of making my mind in waht to order. I will certainly come back!

I found Chi Yatai's menu on Google and know I had to try it. The food did not disappoint! We ordered the ebi katsu sando, chi yatai karaage don AND bento, soy milk tea latte, brown sugar boba tea latte, mentai mayo takoyaki, and milk custard with cocoa powder and strawberry. Everything was so tasty--I felt like I was having a Shokugeki moment. Even the rice in the karaage donburi had this delicious subtle mayo-like taste. It's the details with Chi Yatai that really make the food! The staff were so friendly and gave us recommendations on what to order, and what kind of tea went best with the boba we wanted. Definitely looking forward to coming here again!
This place is amazing. It’s worth the hype. The staff is also really nice and friendly. SHOUTOUT PING! I CANT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE ENOUGH.

Chi Yatai is such a wonderful hidden gem! It’s located in a small food court under street level. We call ahead to place our takeout order. The chicken is insanely good! The karrage and the karrage don are out of the world! I think the thing that makes such a difference is their use of the dark meat chicken- it is so flavorful and juicy! The chicken katsu sando is also amazing, we love it with the teriyaki sauce. As far as drinks go, we’ve only had their fruit tea but it was delish! You can customize the sweetness level.  The owner is so sweet and kind, it’s a treat to talk with her! Give this place a visit, you can’t go wrong!

This is the best Karage Sando I have ever had. They are rare to find and I’ve tried several. This one is the best. The Karage nuggets are juicy thigh meat and the breading was delicious. And they have these custard desserts that are subtle like good Japanese cuisine.  Try it.

Love their japanese street food. The takoyaki and chicken sando are my favorites, but you can't go wrong with anything. The black sesame cheese foam in their drinks is great. I also like the mochi and soy milk cheese foam drink. They have great customer service. The owners are super friendly.
Great japanese street food and the owners treat you like family
Nice people, good food! Also gave us pumpkin pie on Thanksgiving. Follow them on wechat and ig.!
Foods are so expensive. Although the place was nice.

Chi Yatai is an amazing hidden gem!  It's a must try!  We ordered the Chi Yatai chicken karaage (6pcs) and the Ponzo Takoyaki.  Each with its flavoring sauces drizzled gently.  Topped with seaweed shavings.  Yum!!  We also ordered the Chicken Katsu Miso sandwich which was equally delicious.  This sandwich has juicy white breast meat with thinly julienne cut cabbage and miso sauce which gently soaked into the white bread.  The bread was ideal because it was light rather than a heavier bun.  Dessert was absolutely made to perfection We had the Matcha milk custard with fresh strawberries.  The custard will cool and firm and tasty!  Food was delicious! Presentation of the food is appealing and the packaging so cute. Owner- management is extremely friendly and ready to help with food descriptions. So if you're new to Japanese small plates or street food... no worries. Portions are great.  Order a few orders. Definitely shareable. Prices are good too!  My daughter recommended Chi Yatai. Great job!  Remember it's a hidden gem. Located in Chinatown at the Richland Center.  Proceed to the lower level- food court. It's the 2nd business on your left.
Love the fried chicken here

really good place!! The line wasn't too long when we were there. The portions are huge so it was essentially two meals for me lol I got the order with one slider and one tender and it was amazing!!!! I got the extra hot one and I really enjoyed it! If you have a high spice tolerance then definitely get that one, it's not that bad :)  Overall a really good experience. The space was a little compact and a bit dirty but that was probably due to the number of people that frequent the restaurant. I would definitely go again and I've already recommended the place to people

I came here for the first time and it was absolutely the best experience! Although the kitchen was closed (came around closing time), I got to try their Panda Oolong Milk Tea and it was amazing! Also, the owners were very welcoming. Awesome customer service! John and his girlfriend were very accommodating and amiable. I can’t wait to go back and try their food menu!

Y’all NEED to go!! My boy doing it RIGHT! Everything was delicious!!! Perfect balance of flavors and texture and fragrance. I don’t have more pics bc we demolished the food so quickly.  Takoyaki: It’s got legit pieces of perfectly chewy octopus. The bonito flakes are bombdotcom. We got the original. It’s worth driving into Chinatown from the burbs JUST FOR THIS!! We almost walked back for seconds.  Chicken Katsu Sando: The bread was springy soft. We got the miso sauce. The chicken was juicy and flavorful with just the right crunch on the outside. The shredded cabbage bits soaked up the flavor juices and gave it added crunch.  Original Karaage Bento (pictured): Miso soup on point. Rice floofy warm goodness. Chicken was flavorful. Textures galore.  Chi Yatai Karaage Chicken: The homemade sauce is perfection. Good balance of sweet and savory. Textures and flavors are addicting. Perfect with a hot bowl of rice.  Dirty Brown Sugar Green Tea Latte: Fragrant boba. You can taste the organic difference.  Black Sesame Cheese Foam Tea: Sweet/Savory goodness. Fragrant tea.  Milk Custard with Chocolate powder and Strawberries: This might be my new favorite dessert. It’s silky custard that’s airy with a fresh sweetness. The strawberries matched really well. It’s melt-in-your-mouth good!

WOW!! Came here w ONE friend and we ordered FOUR sausages. Yes sausages. Don't even call these hot dogs... Also MUSTARD MUSTARD ALL THE MUSTARD YOU COULD EVER ASK FOR  FOUR for TWO people bc we was feelin HUNGRY and boy were we stuffed.  Came in through the back and we were like Huh???? But then someone walked us to the front where we order and then its self seating!

My boyfriend and I have always wanted to try M Grill, and so his birthday gave us the perfect excuse to try it out! Reservations were very easy to make via their website (we had to sign a contract and put down a deposit because we had a party of 15). Valet parking is available for $4.00, which is very reasonable - especially for LA!  As for dinner, there's an unlimited salad bar that guests can help themselves to throughout the meal. As with other AYCE Brazilian BBQ restaurants we've previously visited, servers come around with different types and cuts of meat so the meat is always hot and freshly prepared. I would say all the meats we had were very flavorful but nothing stands out as extraordinary. I would however, return just for the grilled pineapple (it's cooked with cinnamon and is one of the best things I've ever had!).

Valet parking is $5, worth it because the parking lot is pretty small. It was open parking after we left the restaurant. Street parking is pretty hard to find.  We came right after we landed in LA around 10:00pm and  thankfully no wait as we were famished.  At first glance I was disappointed of the amount of sides they had at the table. But after tasting what they had provided us I was satisfied with the quality and taste!  The meats were good and even better with their special dipping sauce. I like the service they provided and the fact that they cook the meats for you to perfection. Their corn with mozzarella cheese was pretty good, we asked for seconds!  5 stars for good food and service. Also, kudos to this place opening past midnight!
Located in the basement but food is excellent! Many choices in this area, but this is a solid one!

I came here expecting to see Hello Jasmine, but this place is even better! The drinks are great and the owner / workers are nice and friendly :)  When we had questions about their menu and drinks, they patiently explained to us and walked us through - giving great recommendations!  If you’re here, try the (freshly made) takoyaki and black sesame cheese foam drinks ☺️☺️  Am looking forward to coming back again for their food and drinks (and to talk about Jesus 😄)

The owner is really nice, the ambience is relaxed with fun 80s tunes played at a decent volume (Commissary-take a hint), and their baked goods are excellent. The croissant was of particular note, buttery, flaky, crunchy on the outside while moist in the middle. Really terrific! That and they have a small selection of interesting beers on tap. Will have to come back & try the prepared food.

This place is located in the basement food court in Chinatown, it takes over where Hello Jasmine previously was. We got the chicken karaage bowl and chicken katsu bento box which both are cooked with egg and onion and come with Koshihikari rice. The owner, John, was very kind and gave us some background on the Japanese rice and explained some of the dishes to us. The dishes were delicious, and largely portioned, I couldn't finish all of my karaage bowl but my bigger fiance, who got the larger bento box which has even more food and a miso soup, could eat it all(although they didn't have miso that day but kindly subtracted it from our total)  Since the seating area is gone during covid times,  I'd recommend walking over to the Ping Tom memorial park and finding a table to eat there by the river like we did  Thanks Chi Yatai and John, we appreciate the extra attention and kindness!
They were suppper nice and accommodating. Tea was amazing! would totally recommend.

Everything was amazing, chicken was super juicy and seasoned perfectly. If you're adventurous ask for the Dirty Brown Sugar Matcha Boba with Black Sesame Cheese Foam. Sounds interesting.. but tastes amazing

I have tried every bubble milk tea in Chinatown. Some of them are great, but absolutely *NONE* compare to this place. I had the pleasure of meeting one of the owners John, who was the most upstanding person I've ever met in my entire life and was even kind enough to give me a gift of appreciation for stopping there!! I ended up with the panda boba at his suggestion.  Phenomenal. Delicious. There really is not a word to describe it, but I know it was the best I've ever had ever before.. The quality of the ingredients and attention to detail truly make this place set the bar higher than it's ever been. I already want to go back and get something else!!!
Food very well. Breads were home baked. Waitress very friendly. They follow all social distancing rules. Would recommend it. Prices are reasonable. Patio great with mesh no bugs.

Just stopped in to the food court for a drink and we were so happy we found this new place. John was so friendly and helpful. My hot honey citron was exactly what I was looking for (actually served hot and perfectly sweetened) and my husband’s black sesame cheese tea was mild and less salty than other cheese teas he’s tried in the past. Looking forward to trying more of the menu next time we’re in town.

I was blown away by how delicious the drinks and dessert were. Not only that, the employees were so kind and generously spent a lot of time to answer all of my questions. I definitely recommend this place and I can’t wait to go back!
Love the karaage chicken... juicy inside and crispy outside, squeeze some lemon and a sprinkle of salt.... oh yeah, hits the spot!

Chi Yatai is the best place for incredible bubble tea and Japanese dishes. They have the best takoyaki, chicken karaage, katsu sando and strawberry custard I have ever tasted, which are very hard to find elsewhere.  Everything is made from organic ingredient, and they have the perfect balance of flavors and textures that add a sophisticated touch to the dishes. Takoyaki has the warm creamy fillings inside that will melt way in the mouth, especially with its unique combination of mentai (salmon roe), green onions and seaweed on the top. Macha latte bubble tea with sesame cheese foam is what I would urge everyone to try here since it will give you exhilarating experiences of varying savory tastes. I think these dishes are something that anyone can’t help not like once one tastes it.  With the most welcoming and friendly team of wonderful people at Chi Yatai, anyone who visits the place will walk out full of savory food and warmth. Much much recommend this place. Hope to return soon.
Great boba place in Chicago, this place is awesome!

I can never go back to other places’ regular bubble tea after having Chi Yatai’s organic milk tea, especially adding black sesame cheese top which is my favorite!!! For the Fresh fruit tea, they even give you a little fork for eating the fruit after drinking, how considerate!!! Chicken sandwiches, extremely crispy and great tasting!!! Highly recommend!!!!
Got a Boba Tea and tasted great, the owner was also genuinely pleasant.
Amazing Milk Tea !!! Could hands down say one of the best i have ever had !!!!
Friendly staff, delicious tea!! Boba are exceptional. Panda tea (left) is pretty fun, it has two types of boba! Brown sugar boba (right) is also excellent. Im definitely returning
Very good. My children tried bubble tea for the first time here, and the owner was very friendly.

Highly reccomend !! Kindest owners that I have ever met. They keep me coming back with their friendliness but also their boba!! So so good! The brown sugar matcha latte is my favorite drink now and their Chicken katsu sando is outstanding! This shop is my new favorite place to go in chinatown! (They gave me chocolates as well ♡) so cute ♡♡♡
Amazing customer service and even better sandwiches. Try the miso sauce!

i love the dirty brown sugar boba matcha latte and takoyaki balls!! I also really like the panda boba tea latte and jasmine green milk tea. They have recently released new drinks -- the fruit tea and honey citron tea. I really like the fruit tea because it tastes refreshing, not too sweet, and has a variety of fruits in it! Also, the owner is really nice and welcoming. If you any have questions about the drinks or food items on the menu, he is more than willing to talk about the ingredients and share his opinion on it. Stop on by and give it a try ;)
OMG I think I found my new go to boba spot. Boba is not only on point but food and service as well.  Recommendation:  Any drink + Chicken Karaage

COME EAT HERE! What a fantastic addition to the Chinatown food court, not sure how you guys did it but I was converted on the takoyaki, and chicken katsu sando, the chicken karaage was crispy and moist, the custard and boba tea are also a must try! So much good food at such good prices, well done!
Chicken karage and milktea are the best I've ever had in Chicago. The service is also very nice.

if you're looking for some amazing tea and street style food with high quality ingredients i would 100% recommend chai yatai, but even more so for the friendly and super kind staff and owner! definitely worth your time next time you find yourself in chinatown. wishing you all the best! can't wait to go back!

This is one place that is worth the hype!  The chicken karage was honestly the best I’ve ever had.  The ingredients, flavors and menu overall is very thoughtful so that anything you order compliments and elevates the other.  Also, cannot say enough about the service and the owner - you feel like family when you are there.

Wonderful food, Honestly the best takoyaki I’ve ever tried, It’s so pleasant to eat, Not only that but My friend and I were greeted with such kindness and we’re so thankful for that! I wish you guys the best, We’ll be stopping by much more often!

I was in to go to one of my favorite spots in Chinatown to eat.  I was surprised to see a new restaurant that opened in the space where Hello Jasmine used to be.  My wife and I were greeted by the owner John who was so passionate about his food and took care to explain each item on the menu as well as give solid recommendations.  He recommended the takoyaki, Pork Sando, and their signature dessert.  I want to say I wasn't expecting much as I was here for my Szechuan food but we figured gotta try it out.  I am so glad we did.  The takoyaki was amazing, the ball was perfectly crisp on the outside and the inside was tender perfect chew and seasoning.  Very well executed as well as thoughtful twist to a classic dish.  The Pork Sando was as well perfectly executed from the subtle toasting of one side of the bread in keeping it light and fluffy with a crisp.  The pork was perfectly fried the sauces we asked for on side were a great way to make each bite unique and special.  Now for the surprise winner of the day, the milk custard with fresh fruit was honestly mind-blowing insane.  I love custards and this was one of the best I've had with its smoothness and rich fresh flavor.  Even if you eat at another restaurant this is the place to get dessert and bubble tea!  A great addition to the Chinatown food court that I know won't disappoint!
Amazing bubble tea, and the custard was delicious!

Visited Chi Yatai on its second day of its opening and managed to meet the owner John. His drinks are made with organic ingredients and some of his profits even goes to helping the homeless and others in need around the city. You should definitely go visit, if not for the boba then to go meet John and his coworkers. Definitely 5 stars to his customer service. I mean, he even calls people by their names when their boba is ready!
I actually came here last Saturday with a couple of friends, we ordered a drink which not to was very good. We plan on going back this Saturday to try the food.

It's Takoyaki time for Chinatown! I visited the food court as I often do for some delectable food, and saw that Hello Jasmine is no longer Hello Jasmine. It is now Chi Yatai, and it brings some fresh new items to the food court selection.  I was greeted warmly by the staff and new owner, and they explained what sets them apart. No fructose syrups, filtered water and filtered ice cubes, and no powdered teas. They brew all of their tea fresh for their boba chas and use organic milk. Definitely like the sound of that, and so does my body.  Their menu is clean and straightforward, with a logical diagram: Pick a tea flavor, pick some bases, cheese or no, customize the sugar and ice level.  We ordered a matcha, a panda (black and white boba with fresh black tea), original takoyaki, and a large Chicken Karaage. We didn't order any cheese on the beverages this time.  The matcha was excellent, great flavor and balance with the milk. I kept it at 50% sweetness with no ice, it was just right for me.  The panda milk tea had these white bubbles that had a texture similar to a firmer grass jelly, giving you a satisfying chew. Definitely had a fresh taste.  Takoyaki was very tasty, on the soft side and runny.  Karaage had excellent flavor and was very juicy. I wish I could eat this with rice or on a sandwich. The lemon + salt blend gave it a balance range while the meat was very generous in portion. Its very light on tendon, which I think a lot of people will like.  The matcha custard we sampled was my wife's favorite, I hope that makes it onto the permanent menu!  Highly recommend this place for boba tea or a tasty Japanese snack! A nice addition to the already amazing food court's selection.

I ordered octopus pork and chicken nuggets, and a cup of black sesame creamed-green tea. Takoyaki is really the best takoyaki I've ever had. It's delicious, it's soft, and it's not the same as usual. The Fried chicken is just right. Black sesame milk cover is their specialty, really super fragrant black sesame flavor, and green tea very well. Anyway, it's a good place to try
So so delicious!!! Staff are very kind! Chicken sandwich is super good and very fresh!
Great food and kind staff, a must place in Chinatown!!
LEGENDARY PLACE!!!!!!!!!!
